question: Why did the son not want to do a stroke of work?
answer1: He was so lazy and clumsy.

question: Why did the man want to send his son far away?
answer1: He did not want to feed him for the rest of his life.
answer2: He was tired of taking care of his son.

question: Who was willing to take on the youth as a servant?
answer1: a rich man

question: What conditions did the rich man have to take the youth as a servant?
answer1: He was to work three years without pay.

question: How long did the youth serve?
answer1: three years

question: What happened to the youth's clothes over the three years?
answer1: They were worn in.

question: When did the master go to do his buying?
answer1: as early as possible in the morning

question: Why did the master go so early in the morning?
answer1: He did not want to buy something expensive.
answer2: He thought that expensive items were not sold early in the morning.

question: What was the old woman carrying?
answer1: a covered basket

question: How much did the old woman want for the basket?
answer1: four shillings

question: What lay in the basket?
answer1: a pup

question: How did the youth feel when he saw the pup?
answer1: satisfied

question: What was the youth doing when the man got home from his journey?
answer1: wondering what his wage for the first year might be

question: Why was the youth satisfied with the gift?
answer1: He had always been fond of dogs.

question: Who did the man meet before he reached town?
answer1: the old woman with the basket

question: Why did the man decide to buy the basket?
answer1: He thought that this time he would make a better purchase.

question: What lay in the second basket?
answer1: a kitten

question: How did the man feel about the kitten?
answer1: letdown

question: Who will the youth meet when he sets out for himself?
answer1: the old woman with the basket

question: What did the old woman tell the youth to do if he were to take the basket?
answer1: not look into it before he got home

question: Why did the youth open the basket before he got home?
answer1: He kept wondering as to what might be in the basket.
answer2: He could not keep from raising the cover a little, and looking through the crack.

question: What did the lizard do when the youth opened the basket?
answer1: popped out of the crack, and ran across the road so quickly

question: Who did the lizard turn into?
answer1: a man

question: What did the old woman do to the prince's brother and sister?
answer1: turned them into a dog and cat

question: How did the youth feel to hear the prince's story?
answer1: surprised

question: Where was the prince's house?
answer1: a high hill in the distance

question: Why was the youth to be rewarded?
answer1: He saved the prince and his siblings.
answer2: He bought the basket from the witch and saved them.

question: When did the prince and youth reach the prince's home?
answer1: late at night

question: Who was the owner of the powerful voice?
answer1: the prince's father

question: How did the prince's father feel to see him?
answer1: excited

question: How was the youth treated by the prince's father?
answer1: well

question: What did the old man offer the youth?
answer1: a morning draft in a golden goblet

question: What was the youth allowed to do as a reward?
answer1: pick out what he wanted

question: Why did the youth speak to the prince before deciding?
answer1: The prince knew what was most valuable.
answer2: The youth did not know what to pick.

question: What happened because the youth spoke to the prince?
answer1: The youth begged the king for the ring on his finger.

question: What did the ring allow the youth to do?
answer1: get everything that he wanted to have

question: What was the youth's first wish?
answer1: to be dressed in new clothes from head to toe

question: Why did the youth want to play a trick on his father?
answer1: He was none too friendly to him while he was still home.

question: What happened because the youth came home more tattered and torn than he had left?
answer1: His father grew angry and began to scold.

question: What did the youth want his father to do?
answer1: go to the king as his proxy, and ask his daughter's hand for him

question: How did the father feel about his son's request?
answer1: confused

question: What did the king tell the father to do after hearing his story?
answer1: send his son to the king

question: What could be seen from the castle window?
answer1: a great ship from abroad

question: How long did the king give the youth to build the ship?
answer1: an hour or two

question: How will the youth manage to build the ship?
answer1: wish for it

question: Why did the king come down to shore?
answer1: He saw that there were two ships at anchor instead of one.

question: Why did the youth sit on a sand-pile before working?
answer1: to pretend he was building the ship
answer2: to act like building the ship took a long time

question: What happened because the king, queen, and princess realized the youth was more than he had at first appeared to be?
answer1: They decided that the princess was to treat him nicely, in order to find out how matters really stood.

question: Why did the youth not want to tell the princess his secret?
answer1: They were not married yet.
answer2: He wanted to wait until they were married.

question: Why did the princess pretend to be unhappy?
answer1: to trick the youth
answer2: to make the youth tell her his secrets

question: How did the princess feel to find out the truth from the youth?
answer1: excited

question: Where did the princess wish the youth to be?
answer1: on the garbage-pile on the street

question: How did the youth feel when he saw his ring was missing?
answer1: despair

question: Where did the rat go after crossing paths with the cat?
answer1: the castle

question: How was the rat able to get into the rooms of the prince and princess?
answer1: found a little hole through which he crawled

question: Who had the princess given the ring to?
answer1: the prince

question: What happened when the prince put the ring in his mouth and prepared to go to sleep?
answer1: The ring slipped down his throat, and he had to cough, so that the ring flew out and rolled along the ground.

question: Why did the king condemn the youth to death?
answer1: He had made a mock of his daughter.

question: Where was the youth being kept?
answer1: a great tower

question: What happened when the cat felt the water?
answer1: She grew afraid, let the ring fall, and swam to land.

question: Why did the dog have a stomach ache?
answer1: He ate a dead fish that had eaten the ring.
answer2: He swallowed the ring on accident.
